class.name: ShapeCast2D
class.brief_description: Node for physics collision sweep and immediate overlap queries. Similar to the [RayCast2D] node.
class.description: Unlike [RayCast2D], shape casting allows to detect collision objects along the cast area (for instance, beam weapons). Immediate collision overlaps can be easily done with the [member cast_to] set to [code]Vector2(0, 0)[/code] and by calling [method force_shapecast_update] within the same [b]physics_frame[/b]. This also helps to overcome some limitations of [Area2D] when used as a continuos detection area, often requiring waiting a couple of frames before collision information is available to [Area2D] nodes, and when using the signals creates unnecessary complexity. This node can detect multiple collision objects. If you want to use this just like [RayCast2D], use corresponding [code]get_closest_*[/code] methods instead. Cannot detect all objects along the cast motion, but only when collision occurs (same as in [RayCast2D]). [b]Note:[/b] shape casting is more computationally expensive compared to ray casting.

method.name: add_exception
method.description: Adds a collision exception so the shape does not report collisions with the specified node.

method.name: add_exception_rid
method.description: Adds a collision exception so the shape does not report collisions with the specified [RID].

method.name: clear_exceptions
method.description: Removes all collision exceptions for this shape.

method.name: force_shapecast_update
method.description: Updates the collision information for the shape. Use this method to update the collision information immediately instead of waiting for the next [code]_physics_process[/code] call, for example if the shape or its parent has changed state. [b]Note:[/b] [code]enabled == true[/code] is not required for this to work.

method.name: get_closest_collider
method.description: Returns the first object that the shape intersects, or [code]null[/code] if no object is intersecting the shape (i.e. [method is_colliding] returns [code]false[/code]).

method.name: get_closest_collider_shape
method.description: Returns the shape ID of the first object that the shape intersects, or [code]0[/code] if no object is intersecting the shape (i.e. [method is_colliding] returns [code]false[/code]).

method.name: get_closest_collision_normal
method.description: Returns the normal of the closest intersecting object's shape at the collision point.

method.name: get_closest_collision_point
method.description: Returns the collision point at which the shape intersects the closest object. [b]Note:[/b] this point is in the [b]global[/b] coordinate system.

method.name: get_closest_collision_safe_distance
method.description: The fraction of the motion (determined by [member cast_to]) of how far the shape can move without triggering a collision.

method.name: get_closest_collision_unsafe_distance
method.description: The fraction of the motion (determined by [member cast_to]) when the shape triggers a collision.

method.name: get_collider
method.description: Returns the first object that the shape intersects, or [code]null[/code] if no object is intersecting the shape (i.e. [method is_colliding] returns [code]false[/code]).

method.name: get_collider_shape
method.description: Returns the shape ID of one of the multiple collisions at [code]index[/code] that the shape intersects, or [code]0[/code] if no object is intersecting the shape (i.e. [method is_colliding] returns [code]false[/code]).

method.name: get_collision_count
method.description: The number of collisions detected. Use this to iterate over multiple collisions as provided by [method get_collider], [method get_collider_shape], [method get_collision_point], and [method get_collision_normal] methods.

method.name: get_collision_mask_bit
method.description: Returns an individual bit on the collision mask.

method.name: get_collision_normal
method.description: Returns the normal containing one of the multiple collisions at [code]index[/code] of the intersecting object.

method.name: get_collision_point
method.description: Returns the collision point containing one of the multiple collisions at [code]index[/code] at which the shape intersects the object. [b]Note:[/b] this point is in the [b]global[/b] coordinate system.

method.name: is_colliding
method.description: Returns whether any object is intersecting with the shape's vector (considering the vector length).

method.name: remove_exception
method.description: Removes a collision exception so the shape does report collisions with the specified node.

method.name: remove_exception_rid
method.description: Removes a collision exception so the shape does report collisions with the specified [RID].

method.name: set_collision_mask_bit
method.description: Sets or clears individual bits on the collision mask. This makes selecting the areas scanned easier.

members.member: The shape's destination point, relative to this node's [code]position[/code].
If [code]true[/code], collision with [Area2D]s will be reported.
If [code]true[/code], collision with [PhysicsBody2D]s will be reported.
The shape's collision mask. Only objects in at least one collision layer enabled in the mask will be detected.
A complete collision information. The data returned is the same as in the [method Physics2DDirectSpaceState.get_rest_info] method.
If [code]true[/code], the parent node will be excluded from collision detection.
The collision margin for the shape. Large margin speeds up the performance at the cost of precision.
The number of intersections can be limited with this parameter, to reduce the processing time.
